Synonyms.Synonym: Removal of the esophagus - minimally invasive

QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Esophagectomy - minimally invasive
QAPair.Answer: Minimally invasive esophagectomy is surgery to remove part or all of the esophagus. This is the tube that moves food from your throat to your stomach. After it is removed, the esophagus is rebuilt from part of your stomach or part of your large intestine. Most of the time, esophagectomy is done to treat cancer of the esophagus . The surgery may also be done to treat the esophagus if it is no longer working to move food into the stomach.
